meanings.definition: The edge of a raised path or road, typically marked by a line of stone or concrete.
meanings.sent1: The children walked along the kerbs of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to step off the kerbs when crossing the street.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel balanced on the kerbs like a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: The kerbs of the garden path guided visitors like friendly borders.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow paint on the kerbs made them easy to see.

meanings.sent3: He attempted to kerbs his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The coach had to kerbs the team's enthusiasm to avoid exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules helped kerb any misbehavior during the event.
